channel.title: Datastore Working Group?
channel.description:
Following January’s IATI Developers’ Workshop in Manchester, [the blog post writeup](https://www.aidtransparency.net/news/iati-developers-workshop-what-we-achieved) from @bill_anderson and @JohnAdams included the following:
> **We agreed that the Datastore is a key element in the future IATI infrastructure, and that it should focus on delivering IATI data in different formats that people can use to build information products.**
It also listed the following practical achievement from the workshop:
> A working group to advise on governance, functionality and oversight of a new datastore.
This idea sounds good to me. Can I ask what the plan is for forming this working group? What needs to happen to progress it?
As a [contributor to the datastore codebase](https://github.com/iati/iati-datastore/pulls) and [issue tracker](https://github.com/iati/iati-datastore/issues), I’d be glad to join. Perhaps others interested in joining could also add their names to this thread?
